isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3176 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - ENGINE BRAKE SYSTEM

svcsubproc.title: Jacobs Engine Brake
svcsubproc.para: The Jacobs engine brake for the 1991 Caterpillar 3176 engine is controlled by the ECM and by the Engine Brake Enable Relay located in the right instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Enable Relay (239)
svcsubproc.para: Battery power to activate the engine brake solenoids is supplied from the Run Relay through fuse G1 (15 amp) to the Engine Brake Enable Relay on circuit 24A. The power is then delivered to the Engine Brake On/Off switch on circuit 24B (only when the engine brake enable relay is activated).

The engine brake enable relay control coil receives 12V power from the ECM on circuit 24Z. When the Engine Brake On/Off switch is closed, the ground circuit for the relay control coil is grounded at the cylinder head ground bolt and the engine brake enable relay is activated.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake On/Off Switch (188)
svcsubproc.para: The Engine Brake On/Off Switch is a 2-pole, single-throw switch. With the switch in the ON position, one pole completes the ground to activate the engine brake enable relay. The other pole delivers battery power from the Run Relay to the engine brake solenoids.

Operation of the engine brake is electronically linked to the vehicle service brakes when the vehicle is operating in the cruise control mode. The service brakes will disable the cruise control, and if the engine brake switch is in the ON position, the engine brake will activate. Customer specified parameters determine whether the engine brake will "latch" itself on after the service brakes are released or if the engine will "coast" when the brakes are released.
